definitions.definition: A specific commercial enterprise or establishment.
definitions.example: I was left my father's business.

definitions.definition: A person's occupation, work, or trade.
definitions.example: He is in the motor and insurance businesses.
He's such a poor cook, I can't believe he's still in business!

definitions.definition: The volume or amount of commercial trade.

definitions.example: I shall take my business elsewhere.
This proposal will satisfy both business and labor.

definitions.definition: The management of commercial enterprises, or the study of such management.

definitions.example: This UFO stuff is a mighty strange business.

definitions.definition: Any activity or objective needing to be dealt with; especially, one of a financial or legal matter.
(parliamentary procedure) Matters that come before a body for deliberation or action.
definitions.example: If that concludes the announcements, we'll move on to new business.

definitions.definition: (travel) Business class, the class of seating provided by airlines between first class and coach.
Action carried out with a prop or piece of clothing, usually away from the focus of the scene.
The collective noun for a group of ferrets.
Something very good; top quality. (possibly from "the bee's knees")
definitions.example: These new phones are the business!

definitions.definition: Excrement, particularly that of a non-human animal.
definitions.example: As the cart went by, its horse lifted its tail and did its business.

definitions.definition: Of, to, pertaining to or utilized for purposes of conducting trade, commerce, governance, advocacy or other professional purposes.
definitions.example: Please do not use this phone for personal calls; it is a business phone.

definitions.definition: Professional, businesslike, having concern for good business practice.
Supporting business, conducive to the conduct of business.
